removals.reasoning: These inner parentheses are redundant inside the parenthesized numerator. + and - have the same precedence (left-to-right), so (num + factor) - 1 is equivalent to num + factor - 1; the outer grouping for the numerator (to divide by factor) should be kept.

The outer parentheses around the entire right-hand expression and the inner parentheses around the multiplication are unnecessary. Multiplication has higher precedence than addition, and array indexing does not require extra parentheses around its subexpression.
Parentheses around a simple addition used as the right-hand side of an assignment are redundant and do not improve clarity here.

Same as at line 209: outer parentheses and the inner parentheses around the multiplication are redundant. Multiplication binds tighter than addition; the index expression doesn't need extra parentheses.
The outer parentheses around the product are unnecessary. Also the inner parentheses around the cast operand are redundant: use (double)i which is the conventional, equivalent form.
Same as line 240: the wrapping parentheses and the parentheses around the cast operand are redundant.
Parentheses around the array index expression are unnecessary; A[i * ny + j] is clearer and equivalent.

There are several redundant parentheses: the outermost grouping is unnecessary because * and / are left-to-right equal-precedence operators, (double)(i) can be written (double)i, and (double)(nx) can be written (double)nx. Keep the parentheses around (j + 1) because the cast must apply to the sum.
The extra surrounding parentheses around the cast expression are redundant. Use the more idiomatic (uint8_t *)&grid_dim_q_coerce.
Same reasoning as the previous entry: the extra outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around a cast expression; removing them improves readability without changing semantics.
Same as previous: remove redundant parentheses around the cast expression.
Extra parentheses around the cast are unnecessary in function call arguments.
Same: remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast expression; removing them simplifies the call-site expressions.
Same as above: remove unnecessary parentheses around the casted address.
Parentheses around a simple identifier used as a function argument are unnecessary and add visual clutter.
Parentheses around a single identifier passed to fprintf are redundant and can be removed for clarity.
Same as line 311: the extra parentheses are redundant.
Same as line 313: remove unneeded parentheses around the identifier.
Trailing call uses a simple identifier; the surrounding parentheses are unnecessary.
